description.narrative: 1. Secure access to finance for underserved segments of the society in an IDA country, more specifically for women entrepreneurs and SMEs in rural areas. 2. Create a demonstration effect for other MFIs in Central Asia to seek efficiency and economy of scale through a transformation into a bank using Bai Tushum''s success as a role model. 3. Develop a positive economic impact by propping up economic growth, improving access to finance in economically and geographically excluded regions, generating new jobs and improving quality of life at the base of the pyramid. 4. Help the Company to reduce its foreign currency exposure, better manage assets and liabilities, and improve its risk profile at a time of limited currency options.

Bai Tushum & Partners Bank (BT or the Bank) is the first MFI in Kyrgyzstan and Central Asia that has transformed into a bank. It was established as a non-profit microcredit agency in 2000 with a social mission to service vulnerable groups and currently became a leading microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. The proposed project will be IFCs third deal with BT and aims to strengthen IFCs investment relationship with the Bank and to support the Banks strategy to scale up its lending activities towards SMEs, including women-owned enterprises.
